answers.answer: welcome to the forum and your daughter is so very lucky to have your support.  i cant answer your question about the diabetis but for most ppl w/s are not dangerous just painful.  however if your daughter is on day 5 she is about to turn the corner to her new life.  i was on a high dose of oxy and snorted it.  my w/ds lasted about 7 days with 3 and 4 being the worse.  it is very im portant for her to get some aftercre if she is gonna be successful at long term recovery.  the mental part of recovery is definately the worse.  with your help and some good aftercare she can do this.  maybe you can show her this site and she can get some support here.  good luck to you and her and if i can help you feel free to message me...

If she is at day five she the same as got the pyhsical w/d done. Now get good after care N/A meetings she may end up with depression and need some type of A/D meds. Get her on this site and keep us posted Good Luck too you

i don't know the dangers associated with diabetes,however, if she has been clean for five days...the worst of the physical w/s should be over. i find the mental-emotional part much much harder. i would definitely suggest an in-patient program and at the very least an out-patient.has she been to any support group meetings yet?such as AA or NA? if not, i would suggest that she look up a meeting on the internet and go today. from there she can get advice from people who have gone thru this and are going thru this. you will not be able to help your daughter in the same way that a fellow sufferer can.it is alot easier, or in my case, it was alot easier to take advice from an addict than to take it from a doctor. good luck to the both of you

if she is on methadone, she should not experience very much wd at all...as far as aggravating diabetes..had not ever heard of that but rest assured it is not going to harm her as much as massive doses of hydrocodone...the tylenol she was ingesting can shut her liver down which would be much more dangerous than a controlled methadone taper as it contains no tylenollike u...using another narcotic like sub or methadone..does not seem to be the best way to get clean...and it is probably not..but it is the only way some people can get clean so it is better than the alternative..which is continuing to use...as long as a dr is monitoring her and she stays away from street drugs..she is better off..she is very luck to have u in her corner

mental part meaning most addicts have never learned how to identify-cope with-express their emotions/feelings which often leads to their using of drugs. so when getting sober, one of the first things to come back are the emotions and it is essential for recovery that the addict learn how to deal with these emotions. and yes, emotional pain can sometimes feel like physical pain.

....that is why i suggested a treatment program or at the very least a support group made up of people who are going thru and have gone thru what your daughter is going thru.  there are support groups for narcotics (NA) but an option for her also is to try AA, as there are an abundance of these meetings in almost any city around the world.all times of day. open to everyone and anyone who has a desire to stop using.

You said: "most addicts have never learned how to identify-cope with-express their emotions/feelings which often leads to their using of drugs"I say: AHA!  That is true!  She always bottled up her emotions!Thank you!  Now, I know the reason WHY she started this..She is doing pretty good now. I told her about the forum-- she said "not right now".I asked her why and she said she was trying to divert attention to other things--it looks like it's working for her--so whatever works.We found an out patient rehab place and we will be attending NA ... If we can't find NA, then we will go to AA.I am standing by her and watching over like a mother hen--BUT I also know she needs her own space...It's Working pretty good--because she is talking to me more and opening up to me--- gosh, that's been a long time since she did that...I'm glad ya'll are here, cause I need support, too!!!THank you allBest wishes to all !!!

question: Hello,I am new here. My 27 year old daughter has been addicted to mainly hydrocodone and probably some other drugs, but mainly hydrocodone.Addicted for about 3 years and taking  high doses of hydrocodone.I took her to a rehab place and they recommended "methadone" treatment. I know they are the experts, but to me, it just doesn't make sense to replace one addictive drug with another addictive drug.We told them we would research this and in the meantime, she is doing this cold turkey.She has juvenile diabetes.Someone told me that methadone might cause more harm since she is has Type 1 diabetes.Regardless, I am opposed to her taking methadone. Just doesn't make sense.I am trying to get her into a decent rehab place as an "In patient".In the meantime, she is  beginning her 5th day of  detox.I told her to drink lots of water. Don't know anything about this  PHYSICAL withdrawal.What do I expect??Someone said 2 weeks for physical withdrawal and then --- mental.I want to help her during the physical withdrawal--an of course , the mental which I understand takes a very , very long time.Is this life threatening because of her juvenile diabetes?Is there anything I can do to help her thru this??So far, the withdrawals have not been bad......What should I expect??Please help me help my daughter!  And YES-- SHE WANTS HELP.Thank you for any info or advice.
title: Please HELP!  Hydrocodone withdrawal
